metadata.Description: The use of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, or hydroelectric power in water-related services such as water treatment, desalination, or irrigation.

entities.Description: The use of renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, or hydroelectric power in water-related services such as water treatment, desalination, or irrigation.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.

Resilient infrastructure refers to the design and construction of infrastructure systems that can withstand and recover quickly from natural disasters, climate change impacts, and other shocks and stresses.

sub-elements: hydroelectric power in water treatment plants

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services addresses water scarcity issues by utilizing sustainable energy sources for water treatment and distribution.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services employs solar power technologies to generate clean energy for water treatment and pumping systems.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services collaborates with local communities to implement sustainable energy solutions for water services.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services supports water conservation efforts by promoting energy-efficient water treatment and distribution systems.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services administers incentives to encourage the adoption of renewable energy technologies in water services.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services measures the energy output of renewable energy systems to assess their efficiency and performance.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals by promoting clean energy and sustainable water management.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services

relations.Description: Renewable energy in water services is an instance of green infrastructure that integrates renewable energy technologies into water systems.
relations.Subject: renewable energy in water services
resilient infrastructure
relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure implements building standards that ensure the infrastructure can withstand and recover from natural disasters and other shocks.

relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure
relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure focuses on climate change adaptation strategies to ensure infrastructure systems can cope with the impacts of climate change.

relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure
relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure partners with the private sector to leverage their expertise and resources in developing and implementing resilient infrastructure projects.

relations.Subject: resilient infrastructure
relations.Description: Resilient infrastructure contributes to the achievement of various Sustainable Development Goals, such as Goal 9: Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure.

Solar-powered water pumps are a sub-component of renewable energy in water services. They use solar energy to pump water, reducing the reliance on fossil fuels and minimizing greenhouse gas emissions.
relations.Subject: solar-powered water pumps

relations.Description: Hydroelectric power in water treatment plants is a type of renewable energy used in water services. It involves generating electricity from flowing water, such as rivers or streams, to power the water treatment process.
relations.Subject: hydroelectric power in water treatment plants

relations.Description: Wind-powered desalination systems are a category of renewable energy solutions for water services. They utilize wind energy to power the desalination process, converting seawater into freshwater.
relations.Subject: wind-powered desalination systems
